fee_codes.description: with cannulation of common bile duct and/or pancreatic duct
including sphincterotomy and may include removal of one or more bile duct stones
through gastrojejunostomy following previous Billroth II
with multiple (3 or more) biopsies of a specific lesion
with biliary tract manometry
with intraductal cytology brushing or intraductal biopsy
with cannulation of minor papilla
with insertion of first endobiliary prosthesis and/or pancreatic stent (maximum 1)
with insertion of each additional endobiliary prosthesis and/or pancreatic stent (maximum 3)
with oesophagoscopy-gastroscopy and may include duodenoscopy
Nasobiliary catheter insertion
Percutaneous trans-hepatic catheter drainage of obstructed bile ducts including daily supervision and including percutaneous cholangiogram and catheterization to duodenum if achieved
Replacement of catheter in above
Biliary duct calculus manipulation and/or removal via T-tube tract as sole procedure
Intubation of bile duct for obstruction
Cholecystostomy
Choledochotomy (previous cholecystectomy)
Transduodenal sphincterotomy and choledochotomy (previous cholecystectomy)
Choledochoduodenostomy or choledochoenterostomy or choledochocholechostomy
with choledochoscopy, to S276, S280, S281 or S287
Cholecystogastrostomy
Cholecystoenterostomy
with entero-enterostomy, to S281 or S283
Intrahepatic choledochoenterostomy (anastomosis above the common hepatic duct bifurcation)
Cholecystectomy
with choledochotomy
with transduodenal sphincterotomy
with truncal or selective vagotomy
with highly selective vagotomy
with intra-operative cholangiogram, to S287
Choledochectomy for tumour*
Common duct stricture, dissection and/or resection*
Biliary duct atresia, infant (see General Preamble GP12)
Extracorporeal shock wave lithotripsy for bile duct calculi

referenced_codes.description: E662, E666, E668, E702, E680, E681, E669 are payable with Z561, Z558 or Z760.
S281 cannot be claimed with S276.
